hero.title: Who We Are
hero.subtitle: The official reference for Hijri time in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia

aboutUsDetails.description: The Umm al-Qura calendar is the official and approved reference for calculating Hijri days and dates in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, used in all government and private institutions, in addition to being approved for determining religious occasions such as Ramadan, Eid al-Fitr, and Eid al-Adha. The Umm al-Qura calendar is based on precise astronomical calculations to determine the beginnings of Hijri months, relying on the moment of sunset and the conjunction of the moon with the sun on the horizon of Mecca, making it one of the most accurate and regular calendars in the Islamic world. The website aims to provide an updated and easy-to-use digital version of the calendar, enabling users to view Hijri and Gregorian dates, prayer times, and Islamic occasions with high accuracy.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To provide an accurate and reliable Hijri calendar, built on approved astronomical foundations, contributing to regulating worship affairs and official appointments in a professional and modern way.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: To be the first and trusted reference for Hijri time and date locally and globally, serving the needs of individuals and official entities.

features.title: What Distinguishes Us
features.astronomicalUpdates: Continuous updates according to astronomical calculations for the horizon of Mecca.
features.officialApproval: Official approval from competent authorities in the Kingdom.

aboutUsDetails.extendedDescription:
The Umm al-Qura calendar distinguishes itself from other Hijri calendars with high astronomical accuracy and reliable religious reference, as it relies on precise calculations of sunset times and crescent conjunction, according to the horizon of Mecca, making it the closest to religious reality in determining the beginnings of Hijri months. This precise astronomical foundation, linked to the holiest places on earth, gives the calendar high credibility among official entities and religious institutions inside and outside the Kingdom.

Because we understand the importance of time in Muslims' lives, we have provided a comprehensive digital experience that facilitates access to the daily calendar, integrating both Hijri and Gregorian dates, displaying prayer times, and important Islamic occasions in a flexible and smooth manner. The interface has been designed to be compatible with all smart devices, allowing users to browse the calendar quickly and easily without complexity.

The Umm al-Qura calendar is also distinguished as the main reference upon which religious times and rituals in the Kingdom are built, starting from the entry of the blessed month of Ramadan, through Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha, to determining the days of Hajj. This official approval reflects the trust the calendar enjoys and its central role in regulating time in accordance with Islamic law.

The Umm al-Qura calendar is not just a calendar, but an accurate and reliable time system that embodies the connection between science and religion, between astronomy and worship, serving everyone who seeks to adhere to religious times in their daily lives.

users.title: Who Uses the Umm al-Qura Calendar?
users.list:
• Government and official entities
• Mosques and Islamic centers
• Schools and universities
• Individuals in their daily lives
• Companies and institutions in organizing their schedules

finalWord.title: Final Word
finalWord.description: In an age where technology is accelerating, the Umm al-Qura calendar remains the constant we rely on to regulate the times of our worship and our days, and it is more than just numbers on paper; it is a connection between man and time, between astronomy and religion, between Mecca and the world.

apiPage.title: Application Programming Interfaces
apiPage.description: An Application Programming Interface (API) is a set of rules and instructions that enable programs to interact with each other. We use APIs to connect applications, such as a mobile app connecting to a server over the internet to fetch data.

steps.1: Access the National Unified Registration Portal through the Absher platform.
steps.2: Select the Application Programming Interface service to issue a license.
steps.3: Fill in the required data and attach the required documents.
steps.4: Pay the prescribed fees through the electronic payment gateway and attach the payment receipt.
steps.5: Wait for data verification and completion of necessary procedures.
steps.6: Receive the license after final approval. Pay fees and obtain the license.
